Posted: February 1, 2014
												I don't know why I like this game, but I do.There are plenty of problems with it. The physics is off, there's plenty of rendering issues that make the engine feel very dated, there's not enough variety in crops, etc. I could nitpick for quite a long time about how I wish it were prettier and bigger. Because I do wish for those things. In particular don't expect a 'simulator' in the same sense that X-Plane is a flight sim; this has very arcade sensibilities. Nothing wrong with that but, given how little there is to really do, you'll start to crave more problems to deal with.So, sloppy graphics, dull game play, lack of content - why did I click to recommend this?First, don't get it if it's not on sale, there's a limit here. However, there's something sort of relaxing about such casual, basic work. Manging logistics really since you'll often not do much of the actual farming yourself but rather 'hire' workers. What will you be doing? If you're like me, probably this:- Mowing; there are side missions to mow grass. It's fast and easy and gets you some solid cash.- Package delivery, you use a forklift to take stuff around and have to worry about it sliding off the lift at a sharp turn or a big bump (you also need a good lift if you want to make the bigger runs in time).- Hiring workers; you don't have to, you could do it all yourself, but any given field needs to be prepared, seeded, probably fertilized in some fashion, and harvested to start over again. Depending on what you plant and if you get tricky, you can do all this in 2 passes of a field. If you're not tricky it'll take 4.- Driving a wagon; you can't hire someone for this which is why you'll be doing it all the time, driving a wagon up for the harvester to empty into and then taking it to storage until the prices are good for selling. If you tried to do everything yourself it would take all day to manage just a few fields. So, goals... really just make money and get better equipment. Which is part of the problem, once I got the best harvester, the best tractor, could work with any fruit I wanted... that was it. Sooner or later I'd own the map and then what?The game is 'idle fun' until that point, something to do while you're doing other things really, but it wont keep you going for hundreds of hours. It's certainly not for everyone either, so if you don't think you're going to like it, you probably wont, but if the idea amuses you, try it.And if any devs are listening, take it further. More machines. More crop types and side missions. More things to go wrong: bad weather, insects, soil acidity, nitrogen loss - hell, teach me soil science as I play. Mechanic mini-game to fix busted engines? Hell, why not! Make working with animals more invloved too and don't forget long term goals. Make it a bit harder to stay out of debt, force you to compete with other farms, hire you to help with famine somewhere else. These are all just off the top of my head. I know, it's not a game that appeals to everyone, it's not going to pull in game-of-the-year money, just my little wish-list of what could be.For all its faluts it's still a recommendation, a light one but a recommendation.

Posted: January 31, 2014
												Most feature rich and just all around best Farming Simulator available; hands down! This game/sim is head and shoulders above any other farming simulator out there. Do yourself a favor if your debating on possibly purchasing professional farmer or agricultural simulator, try the demos and save yourself some money, they are simply broken garbage compared to Farming Simulator 2013 and you will totally regret purchasing either of them; DONT DO IT!  While the environment may feel slightly dated the models and physics are great with no functionality issues. There is a vibrant and thriving mod community with mod support built directly into the game. After a simple config file tweak to activate developer mode, turn off the frame rate cap and increase the draw distance "bubble" I found this sim to be thoroughly enjoyable much like a giant sandbox. The grind can be tedious for new equipment but a simple save game config file adjustment can result in any account balance you may desire; even when doing that and eliminating the "grind" I still find the game enjoyable and a draw that keeps me coming back for more.

Posted: July 8, 2013
												This game is a 10/10.  Let's break down the score:Graphics- Top notch, some of the best I've seen.  Even better than real life.  I can see the texture on the cow manure.  The clouds are vanilla, the grass is grasshopper colored.Gameplay- Not much to say here.  I can have the full excitement of being a real farmer!  Various tractors are available to use.  Gives me a once in a lifetime experience.Sound- I believe the game uses sound qualities that are not yet released to the public, providing the most lovely sounds I've ever heard.Content- This game features multiplayer.  That's right, you can mow the lawn and take care of the crops with your friends!  Be careful though, some people are jerks and try to ruin your hard work.  Running them over with a tractor shows them I'm not someone you want to mess with.I highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a great farming experience.  Getting lost in my fantasy farm world was the best thing that happened to me since getting held back in kindergarden.

Posted: February 21, 2014
												First, do you like ETS 1/2?  If yes, you will probably like this game for many of the same reasons.  The theme is completely different, but you are still mostly driving around meeting deadlines and getting bonuses for completing "missions" faster.Do you want to be part of the solution to feed America?  Don't you think it's time you busted out the flannel shirt and overalls?  Your tractor is waiting for you to start sowing the field.  Your front loader is ready to start selling hay.  Your harvesters are ready to collect their crops.  Your lawnmower is ready to ... ok, ok....you get the point.It's a good game, and it has a lot of nice mods.  Considering it's about half the price of a full-priced game, it's well worth it.  If you happen to catch it on a sale, even better!Get some of your buddies and enjoy the coop as well.  It makes the game 100x better IMO, and one of the main reasons I like it more than ETS2.Enjoy, and see you in the fields!

Posted: July 8, 2013
												This game is a 10/10.  Let's break down the score:Graphics- Top notch, some of the best I've seen.  Even better than real life.  I can see the texture on the cow manure.  The clouds are vanilla, the grass is grasshopper colored.Gameplay- Not much to say here.  I can have the full excitement of being a real farmer!  Various tractors are available to use.  Gives me a once in a lifetime experience.Sound- I believe the game uses sound qualities that are not yet released to the public, providing the most lovely sounds I've ever heard.Content- This game features multiplayer.  That's right, you can mow the lawn and take care of the crops with your friends!  Be careful though, some people are jerks and try to ruin your hard work.  Running them over with a tractor shows them I'm not someone you want to mess with.I highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a great farming experience.  Getting lost in my fantasy farm world was the best thing that happened to me since getting held back in kindergarden.

Posted: February 1, 2014
												I don't know why I like this game, but I do.There are plenty of problems with it. The physics is off, there's plenty of rendering issues that make the engine feel very dated, there's not enough variety in crops, etc. I could nitpick for quite a long time about how I wish it were prettier and bigger. Because I do wish for those things. In particular don't expect a 'simulator' in the same sense that X-Plane is a flight sim; this has very arcade sensibilities. Nothing wrong with that but, given how little there is to really do, you'll start to crave more problems to deal with.So, sloppy graphics, dull game play, lack of content - why did I click to recommend this?First, don't get it if it's not on sale, there's a limit here. However, there's something sort of relaxing about such casual, basic work. Manging logistics really since you'll often not do much of the actual farming yourself but rather 'hire' workers. What will you be doing? If you're like me, probably this:- Mowing; there are side missions to mow grass. It's fast and easy and gets you some solid cash.- Package delivery, you use a forklift to take stuff around and have to worry about it sliding off the lift at a sharp turn or a big bump (you also need a good lift if you want to make the bigger runs in time).- Hiring workers; you don't have to, you could do it all yourself, but any given field needs to be prepared, seeded, probably fertilized in some fashion, and harvested to start over again. Depending on what you plant and if you get tricky, you can do all this in 2 passes of a field. If you're not tricky it'll take 4.- Driving a wagon; you can't hire someone for this which is why you'll be doing it all the time, driving a wagon up for the harvester to empty into and then taking it to storage until the prices are good for selling. If you tried to do everything yourself it would take all day to manage just a few fields. So, goals... really just make money and get better equipment. Which is part of the problem, once I got the best harvester, the best tractor, could work with any fruit I wanted... that was it. Sooner or later I'd own the map and then what?The game is 'idle fun' until that point, something to do while you're doing other things really, but it wont keep you going for hundreds of hours. It's certainly not for everyone either, so if you don't think you're going to like it, you probably wont, but if the idea amuses you, try it.And if any devs are listening, take it further. More machines. More crop types and side missions. More things to go wrong: bad weather, insects, soil acidity, nitrogen loss - hell, teach me soil science as I play. Mechanic mini-game to fix busted engines? Hell, why not! Make working with animals more invloved too and don't forget long term goals. Make it a bit harder to stay out of debt, force you to compete with other farms, hire you to help with famine somewhere else. These are all just off the top of my head. I know, it's not a game that appeals to everyone, it's not going to pull in game-of-the-year money, just my little wish-list of what could be.For all its faluts it's still a recommendation, a light one but a recommendation.

												For me, this game is a case of "It's so bad, it's good". The core concept of the game is rather simple, to build up a farmland and maintain it. But, the rather broken physics make this game rather fun to see how far you can push the physics. Then you get a few friends and install many mods, and you end up having a lot of fun, which is the only reason I'm going to recommend this. :P If this sounds to your style, then this game will appeal to you. If you are looking for a real farming simulator game, and don't want to break the bank, try FS2015.

Posted: January 5, 2014
												I actually enjoyed playing this game the only thing I didnt really like was the fact you were stuck with only playing one map with the initial base game. (it strongly relies on player made content which you can download elsewhere). As it can be a time consuming game with crops taking a rather long time to grow, graphically it was realistic. And you had a great choice of machines to use once you unlocked them. Playing in online mode was good, cause you could join other farmers games or they could join you to help you on your farm. This game is very repetitive so if your not into just buying this game and then completing the ingame achievements and just farming in general, I wouldnt recommend this game. A good game to play if you just want to kill time.The biggest let down of this game you do not get to herd cattle, sheer sheep or even milk the cows, so from an animal farming point of view this game is unrealistic. When you buy an animal it merely appears in a field and when its ready to havest eg. wool from sheep, appears as a small wool bale next to the field.Would I recommend this game, I say yes from the point of view that its the most realistic farming game at the moment on the market. However if another farming game came with an animal farming feature which was more accurate, plus all this farming game features, I would say buy that game instead. Don't buy this game if you dont like repetitive farming games.

Posted: June 29, 2014
												This one is for Hardcore simulator fans, if you like to dabble in a bit of everything you might also enjoy it, but for Hardcore sim fans this is awesome. It requires you to actually concentrate on what you are doing, no quick fixes here. If you are looking for a Farming Simulator THIS is the only one worth getting, trust me I tried a more recent competitor called Agricultural Simulator or something like that, and the game ran like a dog even with all the settings turned all the way down, it also crashed on a regular basis. Farming Simulator 2013 is however very stable, looks great and runs very well, the only time you will find small lag/fps issues is in multi-player and this is due to mp being peer-peer rather than on a dedicated server. As you can see I have had MANY hours of fun with this game, and about half of that was playing multiplayer with friends.If you're into sims, grab it now.

Posted: September 16, 2014
												What can I say? It's a farming simulator. It has great graphics, good vehicle choice, and several methods to aquire crops, funds, and other things.It also has great modding support, adding even more vehicles and mechanics into the game. Having multiplayer is also a nice touch.With the vanilla game, however, it has its limitations. Aside from 'make money', there are no goals and no directions. There are missions, but those could be considered 'side jobs', eg mow the lawn or forklift this box over there. This offers a great amount of freedom into the game, but it can also be overwhelming for new players.Overall, this is a great farming simulator, but it falls short for anyone expecting it to be more than just a farming simulator.

Posted: January 31, 2014
												Most feature rich and just all around best Farming Simulator available; hands down! This game/sim is head and shoulders above any other farming simulator out there. Do yourself a favor if your debating on possibly purchasing professional farmer or agricultural simulator, try the demos and save yourself some money, they are simply broken garbage compared to Farming Simulator 2013 and you will totally regret purchasing either of them; DONT DO IT!  While the environment may feel slightly dated the models and physics are great with no functionality issues. There is a vibrant and thriving mod community with mod support built directly into the game. After a simple config file tweak to activate developer mode, turn off the frame rate cap and increase the draw distance "bubble" I found this sim to be thoroughly enjoyable much like a giant sandbox. The grind can be tedious for new equipment but a simple save game config file adjustment can result in any account balance you may desire; even when doing that and eliminating the "grind" I still find the game enjoyable and a draw that keeps me coming back for more.

Posted: February 18, 2014
												I've always been a fan of Farming Simulator specifically from Giants since FS2011.  At first i found just driving the highly detailed  and highly animated machines was fun when you're bored.  Eventually I started finding the challange of becoming a millionare fun.   Purchased 2013 for myself and a friend.  Since then we haven't really taken much time off.  Short of my son really loving the tractors it really is an engaging simulation.  As long as you don't modify your career files to give yourself money and actually earn it, the challange to get the "awesome" machines is what makes it so fun.Then there is the modding.  This has to be one of the most modded games i've seen for a simulator.  There are a tonne of awesome mods, some bad but overall an excellent modding community.Multiplayer:Oh and before i forget, i used to play this single player all the time on FS2011.  Since i bought 2013 for me and a friend, I refuse to play single player anymore.  Just not as fun or enoyable.  I absolutely love the multiplayer aspect of this game.The bad...It's poorly optimized.  Even if you have the best machine, you''ll feel a framerate drop at times.  Add mods to the mix and framerate on a medium budget machine becomes impossible at decent graphic settings.  I'd like to see the game engine heavily optimized.  The overall game is the best simulator of it's kind.  Don't fall for the others claiming to be farming simulators.  Giants is known for developing half decent sims.  I just hope they put more in to the game engine.

Posted: December 31, 2013
												Get Ploughing While The Sun Shines !Though I am not usually someone who would play this game I purchased it for when I look after my nephew who is tractor mad and to my surprise this sim title has for me turned out to be gold compared to another farming sim I tried first and which was sadly just rubbish.Farming Simulator 2013 for me in its latest patched Titanium edition is both very simple but at the same time very engrossing with something always in need of your attention in the game so you don't feel like you are waiting it out for a crop to grow especially since this sim does not advance by seasons but can be played in real time speed and with a whole plethera of options covering crop growing speed and many many other things.The other thing that really helps the game is the graphics which portray a very nicely balanced view in any camera mode and lends itself well to the overall feel of the sim whether your ploughing or collecting hens eggs.As for activities and things you can do there is a lot more to the game than simply growing corn in a field as this sim features  the typical farm animals to care for and that form part of the farms income like the cows for instance which can be milked and the milk sold to the local milk supplier.When it comes to crops the choice is large and varied and can for your farm become more than just wheat to sell as you can not only harvest base items like wheat but you can then collect the hay left behind and use that in bales for feeding etc.One of the other things I am impressed by in this sim is the vehicles which are not only nicely modelled but seem to be able to mimick most things in the real world including needing front weights if you are taking an oversized plough out on your tractor.The one thing I would say negatively about this title is the default keys mapping which really should be one of the things you sort out when you get going as the default key setup is not too clever and not very intuitive either but once sorted it helps the game play become smooth and easier.Also of note this title has a huge amount of community of players behind it who have made over 300 mods which cover everything from new maps to a pressure washer for cleaning your vehicles and so there is always something you find to add to your farm.Although this review has not gone too deelpy into the sim and is just a general overview I would still say to anyone who has an interest in this type of gaming to buy this title and find all the great things about it as you develope your farm and feilds.

Posted: March 20, 2015
												FS2013 is a good game, but the graphics (modeling) and game interface are not state-of-the-art.  If you choose the "normal" setting, be prepared for a VERY LONG slog before you can dump the terrible beginning equipment (the combine and most of the tractors are junk).  This means hours of tedious/boring play, inching up in earnings.  If you are a casual player, go with the "easy" setting.  If you are new to the agriculture simulator gaming world, I suggest you only consider FS2013 if it's on sale for less than $10.  Otherwise,  go with the newer Farming Simulator 2015.  It is much better graphically and the game interface and controls are much improved.  The folks at Giants Software have a winner in FS2015!

Posted: October 14, 2014
												Great game!  If you're into twitch shooters and fast paced games then this one may not be for you.  However, if you like to take your time, be maticulous and plan the best solution to gain money the quickest, then I'd recommend you to try this one out.  I'll admit that it can be a little daunting at the start because there isn't much in the way of on-the-fly tutorials while playing, but once you figure out what you need to be doing, the satisfaction is much greater.  Pro-tip: Sell all the crops in your silos that you start the game with and maybe take a loan or two to buy mower attachments.  Buy the front/rear combo attachments that fold/unfold because they allow you the greatest cutting width and put them on one of your starting tractors.  Quick way to get a lot of money from the side missions.  I received almost $30k just from one mission which nearly paid me back for the mowers.  This is a great game!

Posted: August 9, 2014
												...This game is quickly becoming an obsession. Which is a complete suprise. Don't be fooled by the benign title. There is a strong reward feedback loop in this game that may grab a hold of you as it has myself. Besides the merits of being a game about something practical instead of lethal, the game really is actually fun in it's own right. You start small with a field and some equipment, and slowly expand. First it's planting and harvesting. Then it's "gee i really would like to be able to plant/spray/harvest faster" which leads to looking for ways to make money so you buy bigger and better stuff. Then you start expanding by buying other larger fields. Then you get into buying milk cows. Then you'll be like, gee I'd like to feed the cows. Which leads to moving, raking, tedding, baling, making silage, etc. Then you can take the manure or slurry and use it to fertilize your fields, and on and on. Once you have a few fields going and silage operations, you begin to have to juggle your responsibilities. It has gotten quite hectic for me. Really a lot of fun. There are things about the game that aren't tied to reality. Your crops grow silly fast, and I don't think there are seasons. Also, you don't have machines break down in critical phases, like during harvest (a lot of my in-laws farm, and they think that aspect is particularly amusing), but at least it's something that tries to expose the world of farming to those who don't know much about it. So don't be put off by any misconceptions you may have about farming. This game can be quite a lot of fun.

												Great game!  If you're into twitch shooters and fast paced games then this one may not be for you.  However, if you like to take your time, be maticulous and plan the best solution to gain money the quickest, then I'd recommend you to try this one out.  I'll admit that it can be a little daunting at the start because there isn't much in the way of on-the-fly tutorials while playing, but once you figure out what you need to be doing, the satisfaction is much greater.  Pro-tip: Sell all the crops in your silos that you start the game with and maybe take a loan or two to buy mower attachments.  Buy the front/rear combo attachments that fold/unfold because they allow you the greatest cutting width and put them on one of your starting tractors.  Quick way to get a lot of money from the side missions.  I received almost $30k just from one mission which nearly paid me back for the mowers.  This is a great game!

Posted: April 18, 2014
												I purchased EuroTruck Simulator 2 last year on sale for $6 and surprisingly, it was a pretty fun game.  I took a shot on a similar deal with Farming Simulator 2013 and what was really surprising this time about the game was that as your farm grew and you gained more fields, it became more like a real time strategy game where you worked to make your farm as efficient as possible while ensuring that your crops were harvested, manure collected and delivered, sheep shorn, chicken eggs rounded up, hoppers filled, etc.  It became even more challenging when you raised the bar on yourself by increasing the time scale.  Pros were that farming is relaxing and you get to drive big machines.  Strategy play gets difficult as you expand your farming operation which leads to more challenging game play.  It's a sandbox, so you can do whatever you want and you have to be careful since you can loose a load of pallets off your trailer if you try to shortcut across some rocky areas.  Likewise, I found myself trying to use two separate tractors to free my riding lawn mower from being high centered on some poor kid's exercise trampoline he had the nerve to leave outside in his yard.  Some cons for me were the lack of an integrated music player like in Euro2.  Instead I found myself singing the chorus to Craig Morgan's "International Harvester" song over and over again as I putted down the road of middle America on my Amazone mower at a whopping 6mph!   The other con was the inability to customize paint jobs or logos on the equipment as well as the lack of proper signage for the drop off points around town.  Took me forever to figure out that the flour mill wasn't the train station even though there was a train there...why?  No frickin' sign stating FLOUR MILL.  Overall, for $6, you can have some fun being a farmer believe it or not.

Posted: April 3, 2015
												There really are two ways to play farming simulator.One way is the right way.  Plant seed according to fluctuating market prices, wait a bit, harvest the plant and sell it.  Using the money you get, buy better tractors or implements.  If you want to add some more gameplay, download a mod off the workshop or online to get a new tractor or implement to buy.  Sounds boring, but can be rewarding and fun.The second way (my favorite) is the wrong way.  Download a whole bunch of mods (preferably infinite money and really fast cars) and mess around.  Get $50,000,000,000 and fill the entire map with windmills and watch as the civilians walk straight through everything.  Drive at 200 mph off a ramp and fly halfway across the map.Basically, Farming Simulator 2013 is just Do-Whatever-The-Heck-You-Want Simulator 2013.

Posted: August 9, 2014
												...This game is quickly becoming an obsession. Which is a complete suprise. Don't be fooled by the benign title. There is a strong reward feedback loop in this game that may grab a hold of you as it has myself. Besides the merits of being a game about something practical instead of lethal, the game really is actually fun in it's own right. You start small with a field and some equipment, and slowly expand. First it's planting and harvesting. Then it's "gee i really would like to be able to plant/spray/harvest faster" which leads to looking for ways to make money so you buy bigger and better stuff. Then you start expanding by buying other larger fields. Then you get into buying milk cows. Then you'll be like, gee I'd like to feed the cows. Which leads to moving, raking, tedding, baling, making silage, etc. Then you can take the manure or slurry and use it to fertilize your fields, and on and on. Once you have a few fields going and silage operations, you begin to have to juggle your responsibilities. It has gotten quite hectic for me. Really a lot of fun. There are things about the game that aren't tied to reality. Your crops grow silly fast, and I don't think there are seasons. Also, you don't have machines break down in critical phases, like during harvest (a lot of my in-laws farm, and they think that aspect is particularly amusing), but at least it's something that tries to expose the world of farming to those who don't know much about it. So don't be put off by any misconceptions you may have about farming. This game can be quite a lot of fun.

Posted: August 1, 2014
												For me, I love FS 2013.  I grew up on a farm, I went to an Ag school for pre-vet.  So, it's a fun game, although I don't really consider it a game.  It's a simulator....like any other sim, except with this one, you get to be farmer John.  This sim is a great learning tool.  I play with my kids.  I teach them the value and importance of saving and working.  I start each with 100,000 dollars.  I told them thats all the money they get, and teach them about saving...in this case for needed equipment.   It's actually perfect for this kind of thing.  From a personal standpoint, I'd like to see a few changes.  Since there is now an American farm, it'd be nice to see the weather in degrees, instead of celsius.  I know most probably use Centigrade, however, it'd at least be nice to be able to toggle from one or the other.  Also, since you don't have the means at the start, it'd be nice to be able to buy hay and straw for feeding purposes.  You can buy animals and other placeable buildings, so doing this would enhance the simulation.   Additionally, for the American farm, putting the fields in acres instead of hectares would be a nice change as well.   Lastly, it'd be nice to see the seasons change for a more realistic planting experience.  Example, corn in spring/summer, wheat in winter.  Perhaps color coding the calendar with fall/winter/summer would be a good way to accomplish this. If you want a "game" that you can kill hours on, and have some moderate fun....this is it.  Keep in mind...it's a sim....about farming.  Those who work, or have worked on a farm understand....there is ALOT of monotony.  Nothing happens fast on a farm...except spending money....and lots of it.

												One of the best multiplayer games ever. You must manage your money as a team to be able to gain the highest yields for your fields and manage your time well enough so you can pull in big harvests before any spoilage occurs.Found it really supprising that irrigating (watering) isnt needed at all and would at least like to see some circle style fields with sprinklers.Overall there is a marginal amount of variety in the tasks you do and there is some fun to be had with others. Pick this up durring a steam sale and find some farmhands.

												It's like.......why did I buy this?  And the answer is, because I was always going to buy this.   I put it off for a long long time.   I convinced myself in that false way that people can often lie to themselves, that this was sad, and so I didn't buy it to be cool, and that was wrong, okay?  It was wrong.   I now realise the error of my ways.   And yhea, I got nervous, sure.   I sat there wondering whether to buy it or not.   I mean its a big decision because it's not just the cash, is it?  Pride is at stake here.   It's like, if you buy this,  it's like a big long look in the mirror and telling yourself you were wrong - and thats a painful process to have to go through.  So yhea, I broke out into a sweat over it, your damn right I did.     Then I went and had a cup of tea about it, to calm down.   And I knew the whole time I was going to buy it, but its like, sometimes you have to psyche yourself up for these things.   Then I went and sat down and thought, I'm going to do it, I'm going to do it........I'm going to stop thinking about it and do it.    So I did it.    Oh god I did it,    I did it and it feels good.   Oh god I'm so scared.   I've only played the tutorials so far because I'm so scared of screwing my farm up.   I already care about my farm and I haven't even hit it yet.    I'm being pulled in and it feels.......it feels kinda good.And yes I felt shame.   Immediately after I bought it I felt "the shame".  But then I played it, and you know, it set me free.

												Nice gameplay and definitely a plus that they not only allow mods, but also facilitate them. 												Somehow this rather simple farming simulator has captures my attention. It has mediocre graphics and gameplay coupled with comedy physics. This is certainly not an accurate model of what it is to farm but I am in love. When I play this the hours just seem to slip away. Mods can make all the difference in this too as you add more maps and more equipment. In my opinion it is certainly worth a try if you like low production value simulators.

Posted: June 29, 2014
												This one is for Hardcore simulator fans, if you like to dabble in a bit of everything you might also enjoy it, but for Hardcore sim fans this is awesome. It requires you to actually concentrate on what you are doing, no quick fixes here. If you are looking for a Farming Simulator THIS is the only one worth getting, trust me I tried a more recent competitor called Agricultural Simulator or something like that, and the game ran like a dog even with all the settings turned all the way down, it also crashed on a regular basis. Farming Simulator 2013 is however very stable, looks great and runs very well, the only time you will find small lag/fps issues is in multi-player and this is due to mp being peer-peer rather than on a dedicated server. As you can see I have had MANY hours of fun with this game, and about half of that was playing multiplayer with friends.If you're into sims, grab it now.

Posted: October 31, 2014
												This game is awesome! I like the sharp graphics. It makes the game seem so lifelike! It's a little complicated, and they don't tell you all you need to know in the tutorials. (Ex. I needed to fill my sower with this "implement", but it didn't tell me how.)But from what I've seen about farm ilfe, this hits the nail on the head. It's detailed landscape hooks you to the game. Back to what I said earlier, I guess the reason for them not telling you all you need to know is because, they dont want to reveal everything. Which is fine, but if they want to know, tell them how. So, to sum it up, this game has:1, Awesome (Realistic) Graphics2, Detailed Game Mechanics3, Realistic GameUnfortunatly, it does have it's bad sides. One is while your playing multiplayer, once in a while it will "sync data with the other players", which is pretty bad, and that means it'll keep having you wait while you are working with others to establish that perfect wheat farm. All in all, it has a good plot, and I am a guy who is all for simulation games.My Overall Score: 9.5/10 - Really Awesome

Posted: February 28, 2016
												Trying to play this game is pure AGONY. The time and dexterity it takes just to plow a field are brutal, and that was the first tutorial. I personally enjoy slow-paced games, but after trying this I can see that I apparently prefer more of a management style of game than an all-out simulator. I don't want to spend 20 minutes clumsily plowing a field and driving a tractor that makes grocery carts and mop bucket trolleys seem wieldy. The only person I could see enjoying this game is someone who has literally nothing to do and the patience of the most patient saint. I usually like games that other people call "boring", but not this time. Didn't get past the punishing, painful tutorial. "Tedious agony" pretty much sums it up.

Posted: November 10, 2014
												This was fun for a while, and then it got pretty tedious trying to manage 42 fields with only minimal automation tools.  At that point, it became less about planting and harvesting crops, and more about managing the logistics of servicing your hired workers (keep the combines going with regular visits from the tipper, make sure nobody drives up a tree, move this equipment to that field over there).The first few hours of play, figuring how to get things set up and going, was well worth it, though.In future editions, I'd like to see more automation options (truck drivers that can empty the combine hoppers and deliver crops for sale, workers that can drive the fertilizer truck and hay balers, etc.), so that I can manage a large farm while staying sane.

Posted: October 28, 2014
Farm Simulator 2015 is launching 30-OCT-2014 I grabbed this as a cheap steam sale, even in light of FS 2015 coming (I bought that too lol.. I know...).+ Lots of vehicles and tools+ relaxing game play+ vehicle detail is really good+ appears to be a large modding community (although they seem to be pivoting already to FS 2015)+ haven't tried it, but the multiplayer seems well recieved - environment textures not great- ai is lacking severely- some phyics is really, really poor < for a game that focuses everything on the vehicles, this is kind of glaring- plants and ground are block based, so things form and deform unnaturally. (lines, plants, etc appear and disapear as the ground is interacted with)All in all, this a slow paced and relaxing game. It does require some planning ahead and management skills as you grow. Thus far, I have a bustling little farm that is growing a steady pace. Really enjoying it.
